name: narwhal/io-boot
doc: Provides building blocks for byte and character IO streams.

children.name: read
children.doc:
routes `read` calls to `readAll`, `readBlock`, or
`readMax(n)` depending on whether the argument is
`undefined`, `null`, or a `Number` respectively.

children.name: readBlock
children.doc:
as a default implementation, calls `readMax` with no
argument.  This is intended to be overriden or replaced
if block size information is available.

children.name: readAll

returns.doc: the entirety of the remaining input.

children.doc: Returns the entirety of the remaining input.

children.name: copy
children.doc:
pumps data from this source input stream to the target output
stream.

children.name: next

returns.doc: the next chunk of input (from `read(null)`, or @throws `StopIteration` if the next chunk is empty.

children.doc: Returns the next chunk of input (from `read(null)`, or @throws `StopIteration` if the next chunk is empty.

children.name: iterator
children.doc:
A suitable implementation of `iterator` for any type that
is itself an iterator, not merely iterable.

stream.

iterator.doc:
A suitable implementation of `iterator` for any type that
is itself an iterator, not merely iterable.

children.name: IO
children.doc: Unifies an input and an output stream into a single API.

children.name: TextIO
children.doc: unifies a text input and output stream into a single API.

children.name: open
children.doc:
Wraps a raw byte stream with the appropriate text stream
for the given mode.
